member.name: T:Citect.CtApi
member.summary: Citect ctapi wrapper

member.name: M:Citect.CtApi.CtOpen(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Opens a connection to the Citect SCADA API.
member.param: The computer you want to communicate with via CTAPI. For a local connection, specify NULL as the computer name.

Your username as defined in the Citect SCADA project running on the computer you want to connect to. This argument is only necessary if you are calling this function from a remote computer. On a local computer, it is optional.

Your password as defined in the Citect SCADA project running on the computer you want to connect to. This argument is only necessary if you are calling this function from a remote computer. You need to use a non-blank password. On a local computer, it is optional.
The mode of the Cicode call. Set this to 0 (zero).
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value specifies a handle. If the function does not succeed, the return value is NULL. Use GetLastError() to get extended error information.

member.name: M:Citect.CtApi.CtClose(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Closes a connection to the Citect SCADA API.
member.param: The handle to the CTAPI as returned from ctOpen().
member.returns: TRUE if successful, otherwise FALSE. Use GetLastError() to get extended error information.

member.name: M:Citect.CtApi.CtTagRead(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the current value from the given I/O Device variable tag.
member.param: The handle to the CTAPI as returned from ctOpen().

The tag name or tag name and element name, separated by a dot. If the element name is not specified, it will be resolved at runtime as for an unqualified tag reference. You may use the array syntax [] to select an element of an array.
The buffer to store the read data. The data is returned in string format.
The length of the read buffer. If the data is bigger than the dwLength, the function will not succeed.
member.returns: TRUE if successful, otherwise FALSE. Use GetLastError() to get extended error information.

member.name: M:Citect.CtApi.CtTagWrite(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the given value to the I/O Device variable tag.
member.param: The handle to the CTAPI as returned from ctOpen().

The tag name or tag name and element name, separated by a dot. If the element name is not specified, it will be resolved at runtime as for an unqualified tag reference. You may use the array syntax [] to select an element of an array.
The value to write to the tag as a string.
member.returns: TRUE if successful, otherwise FALSE. Use GetLastError() to get extended error information.

member.name: M:Citect.CtApi.CtCicode(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Executes a Cicode function.
member.param: The handle to the CTAPI as returned from ctOpen().
The command to execute.
The Citect SCADA window to execute the function. This is a logical Citect SCADA window (0, 1, 2, 3 etc.) not a Windows Handle.
The mode of the Cicode call. Set this to 0 (zero).
The buffer to put the result of the function call, which is returned as a string. This may be NULL if you do not require the result of the function.

The length of the sResult buffer. If the result of the Cicode function is longer than the this number, then the result is not returned and the function call does not succeed, however the Cicode function is still executed. If the sResult is NULL then this length needs to be 0.
CTOVERLAPPED structure. This structure is used to control the overlapped notification. Set to NULL if you want a synchronous function call.
member.returns: TRUE if successful, otherwise FALSE. Use GetLastError() to get extended error information.

member.name: M:Citect.CtApi.CtFindFirstEx(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.IntPtr@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches for the first object in the specified database which satisfies the filter string specified by cluster.
member.param: The handle to the CTAPI as returned from ctOpen().
The table, device, trend, or alarm data to be searched.
Filter criteria.
Specifies on which cluster the ctFindFirst function will be performed. If left NULL or empty string then the ctFindFirst will be performed on the active cluster if there is only one.
The pointer to the found object handle. This is used to retrieve the properties.
This argument is no longer used, pass in a value of 0 for this argument.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a search handle used in a subsequent call to ctFindNext() or ctFindClose(). If the function does not succeed, the return value is NULL. To get extended error information, call GetLastError()

member.name: M:Citect.CtApi.CtFindNext(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Retrieves the next object in a search initiated by ctFindFirst().
member.param: Handle to the search, as returned by ctFindFirst().
The pointer to the found object handle. This is used to retrieve the properties.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is TRUE (1). If the function does not succeed, the return value is FALSE (0). To get extended error information, call GetLastError()

member.name: M:Citect.CtApi.CtFindClose(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Closes a search initiated by ctFindFirst().
member.param: Handle to the search, as returned by ctFindFirst().
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is non-zero. If the function does not succeed, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError().

member.name: M:Citect.CtApi.CtGetProperty(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.UInt32,System.UIntPtr@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves an object property.
member.param: Handle to the search, as returned by ctFindFirst().
The name of the property to be retrieved.

The result buffer to store the read data. The data is raw binary data, no data conversion or scaling is performed. If this buffer is not large enough to receive the data, the data will be truncated, and the function will return false.
Length of result buffer. If the result buffer is not large enough to receive the data, the data will be truncated, and the function will return false.
Length of returned result. You can pass NULL if you want to ignore this parameter.
The desired return type.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is non-zero. If the function does not succeed, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError().

member.name: M:Citect.CtApi.OpenAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Open the connection
member.param: The computer you want to communicate with via CTAPI. For a local connection, specify NULL as the computer name. The Windows Computer Name is the name as specified in the Identification tab, under the Network section of the Windows Control Panel.

Your username as defined in the Citect SCADA project running on the computer you want to connect to. This argument is only necessary if you are calling this function from a remote computer. On a local computer, it is optional.

Your password as defined in the Citect SCADA project running on the computer you want to connect to. This argument is only necessary if you are calling this function from a remote computer. You need to use a non-blank password. On a local computer, it is optional.

member.summary: Open the connection

member.param: The computer you want to communicate with via CTAPI. For a local connection, specify NULL as the computer name. The Windows Computer Name is the name as specified in the Identification tab, under the Network section of the Windows Control Panel.

Your username as defined in the Citect SCADA project running on the computer you want to connect to. This argument is only necessary if you are calling this function from a remote computer. On a local computer, it is optional.

Your password as defined in the Citect SCADA project running on the computer you want to connect to. This argument is only necessary if you are calling this function from a remote computer. You need to use a non-blank password. On a local computer, it is optional.

member.summary: Ends Citect SCADA's operation

The full path of the project to run on restart as a string.
The type of shutdown.
The name of the cluster to which the machine(s) named in Dest belong.
Flag for initiating a user-specified shutdown event prior to shutting down.
member.returns: 0 (zero) if successful, otherwise an error code will return

member.name: T:Citect.CtApiTrnQueryEx
member.summary: Extension methods to search trend data

member.name: M:Citect.CtApiTrnQueryEx.TrnQuery(Citect.CtApi,System.Int64,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Int32,System.String,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Search trend data.
member.param: End time of the trend query in seconds since 1970 as an integer. This time is expected to be a UTC time (Universal Time Coordinates).
Millisecond portion of the end time as an integer, expected to be a number between 0 and 999.
Time period in seconds between the samples returned as a floating point value.

Number of samples requested as an integer. The start time of the request is calculated by multiplying the Period by NumSamples - 1, then subtracting this from the EndTime. The actual maximum amount of samples returned is actually NumSamples + 2. This is because we return the previous and next samples before and after the requested range.This is useful as it tells you where the next data is before and after where you requested it.
The name of the trend tag as a string. This query only supports the retrieval of trend data for one trend at a time.
Specifies the different options for formatting and calculating the samples of the query as an unsigned integer. See to calculate this value.

Mode of this request as an integer. 1 if you want the timestamps to be returned with their full precision and accuracy. Mode 1 does not interpolate samples where there were no values. 0 if you want the timestamps to be calculated, one per period. Mode 0 does interpolate samples, where there was no values.
An integer specifying whether the query is for an instant trend. 1 if for an instant trend. 0 if not.
An integer specifying the requested sample period in milliseconds for the instant trend's tag value.
Specifies on which cluster the Find function will be performed. If left NULL or empty string then the Find will be performed on the active cluster if there is only one.

member.name: M:Citect.CtApiTrnQueryEx.TrnQueryAsync(Citect.CtApi,System.Int64,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Int32,System.String,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Search trend data.
member.param: End time of the trend query in seconds since 1970 as an integer. This time is expected to be a UTC time (Universal Time Coordinates).
Millisecond portion of the end time as an integer, expected to be a number between 0 and 999.
Time period in seconds between the samples returned as a floating point value.

Number of samples requested as an integer. The start time of the request is calculated by multiplying the Period by NumSamples - 1, then subtracting this from the EndTime. The actual maximum amount of samples returned is actually NumSamples + 2. This is because we return the previous and next samples before and after the requested range.This is useful as it tells you where the next data is before and after where you requested it.
The name of the trend tag as a string. This query only supports the retrieval of trend data for one trend at a time.
Specifies the different options for formatting and calculating the samples of the query as an unsigned integer. See to calculate this value.

Mode of this request as an integer. 1 if you want the timestamps to be returned with their full precision and accuracy. Mode 1 does not interpolate samples where there were no values. 0 if you want the timestamps to be calculated, one per period. Mode 0 does interpolate samples, where there was no values.
An integer specifying whether the query is for an instant trend. 1 if for an instant trend. 0 if not.
An integer specifying the requested sample period in milliseconds for the instant trend's tag value.
Specifies on which cluster the Find function will be performed. If left NULL or empty string then the Find will be performed on the active cluster if there is only one.

member.name: M:Citect.CtApiTrnQueryEx.ToTrnData(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String}})
member.summary: Convert the result of TrnQuery
member.param: The raw TrnData returned by TrnQuery function

member.name: T:Citect.TrnData
member.summary: The following properties are returned for each data record of the query.

member.name: P:Citect.TrnData.DateTimeSeconds
member.summary: Time of the trend sample in seconds since 1970 as an integer in UTC (Universal Time Coordinates).

member.name: P:Citect.TrnData.DateTimeMSeconds
member.summary: Millisecond component of the time of the trend sample as an integer.This value is inbetween 0 and 999.

member.name: P:Citect.TrnData.DateTime
member.summary: Get the time of the trend sample in type.

member.name: P:Citect.TrnData.Value
member.summary: Trend value of the sample as a double.

member.name: P:Citect.TrnData.Quality
member.summary: The quality information associated with the trend sample as an unsigned integer.

member.name: P:Citect.TrnData.ValueType
member.summary: The quality information associated with the trend sample.

member.name: P:Citect.TrnData.ValueQuality
member.summary: The quality information associated with the trend sample.

member.name: P:Citect.TrnData.LastValueQuality
member.summary: The quality information associated with the trend sample.

member.name: P:Citect.TrnData.Partial
member.summary: Indicates that the sample may change the next time it is read. This occurs when you get samples right at the current time, and a sample returned is not necessarily complete because more samples may be acquired in this period.

member.name: T:Citect.DisplayMode
member.summary: Options for formatting and calculating the samples of the query as an unsigned integer.

member.name: M:Citect.DisplayMode.Get(Citect.Ordering,Citect.Condense,Citect.Stretch,System.UInt32,Citect.BadQuality,Citect.Raw)
member.summary: Calculate the displayMode property
member.param: Ordering Trend sample options
Condense method options
Stretch method options
Gap Fill Constant option (the number of missed samples that the user wants to gap fill)
Last valid value option
Raw data option
member.returns: Options for formatting and calculating the samples of the query as an unsigned integer.

member.name: T:Citect.Ordering
member.summary: Ordering Trend sample options

member.name: F:Citect.Ordering.OldestToNewest
member.summary: Order returned samples from oldest to newest.

member.name: F:Citect.Ordering.NewestToOldest
member.summary: Order returned samples from newest to oldest. This mode is not supported when the Raw data option has been specified.

member.name: T:Citect.Condense
member.summary: Condense method options

member.name: F:Citect.Condense.Mean
member.summary: Set the condense method to use the mean of the samples.

member.name: F:Citect.Condense.Minimum
member.summary: Set the condense method to use the minimum of the samples.

member.name: F:Citect.Condense.Maximum
member.summary: Set the condense method to use the maximum of the samples.

member.name: F:Citect.Condense.Newest
member.summary: Set the condense method to use the newest of the samples.

member.name: T:Citect.Stretch
member.summary: Stretch method options

member.name: F:Citect.Stretch.Step
member.summary: Set the stretch method to step.

member.name: F:Citect.Stretch.Ratio
member.summary: Set the stretch method to use a ratio.

member.name: F:Citect.Stretch.Raw
member.summary: Set the stretch method to use raw samples (no interpolation).

member.name: T:Citect.BadQuality
member.summary: Last valid value option

member.name: F:Citect.BadQuality.Zero
member.summary: If we are leaving the value given with a bad quality sample as 0.

member.name: F:Citect.BadQuality.LastValidValue
member.summary: If we are to set the value of a bad quality sample to the last valid value (zero if there is no last valid value).

member.name: T:Citect.Raw
member.summary: Raw data option

member.name: F:Citect.Raw.None
member.summary: If we are not returning raw data, that is we are using the condense and stretch modes to compress and interpolate the data.

member.name: F:Citect.Raw.Totaly
member.summary: If we are to return totally raw data, that is no compression or interpolation. This mode is only supported if we have specified the DataMode of the query = 1. When using this mode, more samples than the maximum specified above will be returned if there are more raw samples than the maximum in the time range.

member.name: T:Citect.ValueType
member.summary: Quality information associated with the trend sample

member.name: F:Citect.ValueType.None
member.summary: There is no value in the given sample. Ignore the sample value, time and quality.

member.name: F:Citect.ValueType.Interpolated
member.summary: The value has been interpolated from data around it.

member.name: F:Citect.ValueType.SingleRaw
member.summary: The value is based on one raw sample.

member.name: F:Citect.ValueType.MultipleRaw
member.summary: The value has been calculated from multiple raw samples.

member.name: T:Citect.ValueQuality
member.summary: Quality information associated with the trend sample

member.name: F:Citect.ValueQuality.Bad
member.summary: Ignore the value of the sample as there was no raw data to base it on.

member.name: F:Citect.ValueQuality.Good
member.summary: The value of the sample is valid, and is based on some raw data.

member.name: T:Citect.LastValueQuality
member.summary: Quality information associated with the trend sample

member.name: F:Citect.LastValueQuality.Bad
member.summary: The value of the sample should be ignored as there was no raw data to base it on.

member.name: F:Citect.LastValueQuality.Good
member.summary: The value quality of the last raw sample in the period was good.

member.name: F:Citect.LastValueQuality.NotAvailable
member.summary: The value quality of the last raw sample in the period was Not Available.

member.name: F:Citect.LastValueQuality.Gated
member.summary: The value quality of the last raw sample in the period was Gated.
